General Questions.question: What is ANC Davao?
General Questions.answer: ANC (Archdiocesan Nourishment Center) is a faith-driven initiative under ACLAIM of The Roman Catholic Bishop of Davao, Inc., dedicated to fighting hunger and uplifting lives through feeding, education, health, and spiritual programs.

General Questions.question: Is ANC a government agency?
General Questions.answer: No, ANC is a church-based nonprofit initiative under the Archdiocese of Davao. It operates independently from government programs but works in partnership with public and private institutions.

General Questions.question: Where is ANC located?
General Questions.answer: ANC is based in Davao City, Philippines, operating under the Archdiocese of Davao with community reach throughout various barangays.

Donations.question: How can I donate?
Donations.answer: Donations can be made via bank transfer, in-kind giving, or through our official donation channels. Visit our Donate page for full details.

Donations.question: Where do donations go?
Donations.answer: All donations directly support our feeding programs, scholarship grants, health services, and spiritual outreach efforts.

Donations.question: Are donations tax-deductible?
Donations.answer: ANC is a registered charitable organization. We can issue official receipts upon request. Please consult your accountant or local tax laws for deductibility.

Donations.question: Can I give in-kind donations?
Donations.answer: Yes! We accept food supplies, hygiene kits, school materials, and more. Please contact our team to coordinate drop-offs.

Volunteering.question: How can I volunteer?
Volunteering.answer: You can join our mission by signing up through our website or messaging us on Facebook. Roles include cooking, distribution, education, and community work.

Volunteering.question: Do I need experience to volunteer?
Volunteering.answer: Not at all. We welcome volunteers from all walks of life. Training and orientation are provided.

Volunteering.question: Can groups or organizations volunteer together?
Volunteering.answer: Absolutely! We encourage group volunteering from schools, parishes, and offices. Just let us know in advance to coordinate.

Programs.question: What programs does ANC offer?
Programs.answer: ANC operates core programs focused on nourishment (feeding), education (scholarships), health (medical missions), and spiritual formation (pastoral care).

Programs.question: Who are the beneficiaries?
Programs.answer: Our beneficiaries include undernourished children, low-income families, out-of-school youth, and communities facing poverty.

Programs.question: Can I sponsor a child or program?
Programs.answer: Yes, you can sponsor a child, feeding program, or scholarship. Please contact us to learn more about available sponsorship opportunities.

Partnerships.question: How can my organization partner with ANC?
Partnerships.answer: We welcome partnerships with schools, parishes, businesses, and civic groups. Reach out through our contact page to start a conversation.

Partnerships.question: What kinds of partnerships are available?
Partnerships.answer: You can partner with ANC through funding, joint outreach activities, corporate volunteering, in-kind donations, or educational collaboration.

Partnerships.question: Can we collaborate on long-term projects?
Partnerships.answer: Yes. ANC seeks sustainable partnerships that can expand the impact of our programs. Letâ€™s explore long-term collaboration opportunities together.
